definition: to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither

sentences.english: Sit down and plan out a strategy for defeating your doubt.
sentences.chinese: 坐下來然後制定一項擊敗懷疑的計劃。

sentences.english: Satan and the rebel angels have been roundly defeated.
sentences.chinese: 撒旦和叛亂天使們被徹底擊敗了。

sentences.english: The kingdom was conquered by the Mongol and Chinese armies of Kublai Khan.
sentences.chinese: 大理王國後來被忽必烈率領的蒙漢聯軍擊敗。

sentences.english: That fellow exulted over a defeated rival.
sentences.chinese: 那傢伙因擊敗對手而得意洋洋。

sentences.english: Rafael Nadal rejoices after defeating Robin Soderling in the men's final June 6.
sentences.chinese: 納達爾擊敗而高興在男子決賽6月6日索德林。

sentences.english: And China's Wang Liqin defeated Sweden's Jorgen Persson for bronze.
sentences.chinese: 而中國的王勵勤擊敗瑞典的佩爾森獲得銅牌。

sentences.english: It's a shame we were unable to beat Albinoleffe.
sentences.chinese: 未能擊敗阿爾比諾勒菲非常羞恥。

sentences.english: Together they defeated the Babylonian army.
sentences.chinese: 他們一起擊敗了巴比倫軍隊。

sentences.english: Defeated a powerful enemy with graceful poise.
sentences.chinese: 用高雅的身姿擊敗強大的敵人。

sentences.english: HujiangGuy：You should not crow over a defeated enemy.
sentences.chinese: 你不應該在被你擊敗的敵手面前大吹大擂。

sentences.english: Mr. Farmer still doesn’t quite know what hit him.
sentences.chinese: 法默先生到現在仍然不知道他是如何被擊敗的。

sentences.english: Lothar defeats the rebels at Northshire.
sentences.chinese: 洛薩擊敗了在北郡的叛軍。

sentences.english: Japan defeated Sweden in the other semifinal game.
sentences.chinese: 另一場半決賽中，日本隊擊敗了瑞典隊。

sentences.english: With his defenses stripped, Windu was easily overpowered by Chancellor Palpatine.
sentences.chinese: 失去防禦力的溫杜被帕爾帕廷議長輕易擊敗。

sentences.english: The victory was scored one day after China edged out Singapore to win the womens team title.
sentences.chinese: 一天前，中國隊擊敗新加坡隊奪得女團冠軍。

sentences.english: We were outvoted by the senior citizens in the community.
sentences.chinese: 我們被社區裏的老住戶給投票擊敗了。

definition: to defeat/to overpower/to beat/to be defeated
to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph
to win by a narrow margin/to barely win/narrow victory
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel
St Paul/São Paulo, city in Brazil
to fit one into the other/to bring two things into contact
